pullrequest.title: Create a standard configuration for VMRC

content.raw:
I added a brief example in the tutorials: [#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/ExampleVmrc](#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/ExampleVmrc)

I added a two launch files and an Rviz config flle to support the tutorial - making it easier to run the example without making edits.

I also separated the rviz config and launch files from the “example” files used in the \[rviz tutorial\]\([#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/Visualizing with RVIZ](#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/Visualizing%20with%20RVIZ)\).  I don’t believe that the Rviz example and the VMRC examples are compatible.  Still need to retry the rviz example using this branch.

Two questions

1. When I run the this rviz example I don’t have a good fixed frame.  Without running robot localization there doesn’t appear to be a transform form odom to the robot frame.  Thoughts?
2. The location of the LiDAR and cameras seems to be a bit high above the WAM-V sensor deck - see the image

I added a brief example in the tutorials: #!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/ExampleVmrc

I added a two launch files and an Rviz config flle to support the tutorial - making it easier to run the example without making edits.

I also separated the rviz config and launch files from the “example” files used in the [rviz tutorial](#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/Visualizing with RVIZ). I don’t believe that the Rviz example and the VMRC examples are compatible. Still need to retry the rviz example using this branch.

Two questions

  1. When I run the this rviz example I don’t have a good fixed frame. Without running robot localization there doesn’t appear to be a transform form odom to the robot frame. Thoughts?
  2. The location of the LiDAR and cameras seems to be a bit high above the WAM-V sensor deck - see the image
